node.text:
Travelling and traversing, escape and escapades - the Spring 2022 Lanvin collection by creative director @BrunoSialelli explores exploration, the idea of travel, our wanderlust to view the world. Showcased once again through motion images - a filmic short which, like a music video, gives a taste of the ideology behind a creative outing - the collection itself is a trip, real or imaginary, nostalgic or anticipatory. It transports.

Those emotions and intentions mingle: the collection itself glances backwards, journeying into memories of the 1990s - a formative period of modern fashion - and to the archives of Lanvin. It also references the glamour of travel in the past, the aspirational style dubbed the ‘jet-set’, the notion of travel as an indulgence, an extravagance, an occasion. Lanvin reinvents the 1970s Lanvin ‘JL’ monogram: drawn from the archive, it is redrawn, updated for today as the JL 3-D, with a modernist feeling - like an architectural detail. As a print or jacquard it is used in optical play, also adorning accessories and luggage, like the accoutrements of travellers past, and future.

Lanvin’s home is Paris: this travelogue exports the values and signatures of the oldest Parisian fashion house to different corners of the world, expressing a style that is quintessentially Lanvin. This includes both Jeanne Lanvin, and her successors - micro-florals and couture silhouettes reflect the mid-century work of Antonio Castillo, contemporary of Balenciaga and Dior, the Lanvin logo an evolution of that created by Jules-François Crahay in the 1970s. This heritage is another trip - it marks the journey of the house since its birth in 1889. 

Creative direction : @brunosialelli
Styling : @mr_carlos_nazario
Film Director : @helmimagemaker
Production : @division.global
Hair : @yann_turchi
Make-up : @cecileparavina
Casting models : rachel_chandler
@alydagrace
@iamhyunjishin
@luvresval 
@boularoc
@_jodeci 

« Pure Shore » performed by ALL SAINTS
(p) 2000 Warner Music UK Ltd.
(W. Orbit)

Spring/Summer 2021, Yu Garden - Full show. 
Elegance, optimism, joie de Vivre.
#LanvinYUGARDEN

Creative direction @brunosialelli 
Styling @mr_carlos_nazario

node.text:
Lanvin announces an ongoing partnership with The House of Xclusive Lanvin, the ballroom group named after the Parisian couture house. As a first-of-its-kind collaboration, a ballroom house and a fashion house are working together on a large-scale project.

Lanvin and The House of Xclusive-Lanvin present “La Mère et L’enfant”, a short narrative film directed by Mayan Toledano (@thisismayan) at the Lanvin SoHo boutique, in NYC. Staring 25 members of @houseofxclusivelanvin and actress/model/activist @indyamoore, the film depicts the notion of motherhood, a key theme of the ballroom scene, and interprets Lanvin’s historical emblem “La Mère et L’enfant” (“mother and child”).
 
“Seeing the House of Xclusive-Lanvin recalls Lanvin’s origin to me as its founder Jeanne Lanvin created and then built an empire in the 1920s 1930s for the love of Marguerite, her only child. There is a fascination to understand and feel how a “mother” can create a system beyond herself to offer a world to her “children”, to push back limits and protect a space where expression becomes everything, allowing all possibilities. Today, this is the deep notion of motherhood, not etymologically but philosophically.”
@brunosialelli Lanvin Creative Director
 
Set against @MileyCyrus “Midnight Sky,” the video, shot entirely on iPhone 11 Pro Max, brings to life the key elements of ballroom competition showcasing traditional ballroom categories, serving Face, Body, Fashion,  Runway and Voguing realness. This film is a first chapter of an ongoing partnership between the two houses.
 
“Welcome Mother, your children have been waiting for you!”

Thanks a lot to @barbie_idol @dashaunwesley @jlinfamous- @_TimTobias @theexxotichottie @eyricka_flawless @jonoviac @Corey_Lanvin @Vinshaidesigns @d_fonta @ricky_estates @mynameisdex @Sexykey319 @Mstashsolovelee @DemitriusJackson @Ken_possible @mrgoodbarnyc @richierich.red @kay_bae0901 @_packrat_ @carlos_lanvin @bka_pretty @zaylanvin_ @kemar_jewel @demitrius215

#lanvin #houseofxclusivelanvin #hoxl #lanvinbybrunosialelli #brunosialelli #shotoniphone

node.text:
The environment of the #LanvinSS21 collection’s imagery is #LePalaisIdeal, an extraordinary example of naïve art architecture executed by Ferdinand Cheval, a French postman who literally made his dream. Built over thirty-three years at the turn of the twentieth century, his fantastical reimagining of a medieval castle became a point of homage and pilgrimage to artists such as André Breton, Pablo Picasso and Max Ernst. Anaïs Nin celebrated his achievement in an essay. Here, the Ideal Palace becomes a total work of art, framing clothes devised for its imaginary inhabitants.
Discover more via link in bio.
#Lanvin
Film by @theo_stefanini

node.text:
Last episode: BRUNO SIALELLI’S INSIGHTS 
Professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_) asked her students at MA Fashion Curation at @lcflondon_ and #Lanvin's Instagram community to send in questions addressed to Creative Director @brunosialelli as an extension of the #LanvinDialogues short IGTV series.
"We had such wonderful feedback that we have themed the questions into broader areas of interest around his use of the incredible historic archive we have been celebrating, and how he imagines the future of the house."Judith Clark.

node.text:
Fifth episode:
EMBELLISHMENT
"Embellishment was, and still is, so integral to the house of Lanvin: how to achieve the beauty of effect - with pattern and light - and to imagine the wearer's movement. The sample books in the archive give us a clue to the wealth of skills developed for the collections, but also of experimentation (some found here were never used). Bows run through the archive, as delicate fastenings, then abstracted as the essential feminine motif, and then find their way into new menswear collections - Bruno Sialelli keeping the archive alive through re-description, and re-interpretation." Judith Clark

We look at #Lanvin’s embellishment, through conversations between professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_), @Laure_Harivel, Head of Archives at Lanvin, #AdamPhillips, Psychoanalyst and Writer, and #AmydelaHaye, Professor of Dress History and Curatorship, all invited by Creative Director @BrunoSialelli to discuss Lanvin’s past and present from their home.

Full episode via @Lanvinofficial IGTV.

node.text:
Fourth episode: 
STAGING LANVIN
"When I was curating #Lanvin130thAnniversary exhibition in Shanghai at the @Fosunfoundation I was mindful that Jeanne Lanvin paid huge attention to how her collections were staged - In the archive we can discover that she not only participated in International Expos (looking in detail at the mise en scene and mannequins), but also collaborated with avant-garde writers and directors, creating costumes for theatre and film. In a move that was so forward thinking she dressed actresses like #YvonnePrintemps - who became a house muse" Judith Clark

We look at #Lanvin’s relationship with art and theatre, through conversations between professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_), @PaulaAlaszkiewicz, Fashion historian, @SeminaraAngelo, Hair stylist, and @Karen_binnszzzz, Stylist and editor, all invited by Creative Director @BrunoSialelli to discuss Lanvin’s past and present from their home. 
Full episode via @Lanvinofficial IGTV.

node.text:
Third episode: 
LOGO & DAISY
« During Bruno Sialelli’s first collection at the Musee Cluny in Paris, I remember looking down at the carpet and seeing the tiny graphic daisies drawn between the J’s and the L’s. They appeared on the shirts, the skirts and painted on the back of Men’s trousers - it was wonderful later in the year to have access to the archive and see the daisies embroidered as delicate early samples, scattered on children’s clothes, and remembered with every reference to Madame Lanvin’s daughter Marguerite.
The mother and daughter bond was so important to Lanvin, made iconic with the modern logo that shows them about to dance, or having just danced - we never quite know. » Judith Clark

We look at #Lanvin's logo and daisy emblems, through conversations between professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_), Jennifer Higgie @bowdownpodcast, Editor at large of @Frieze_Magazine, @LukeEdwardHall, artist, and #CloePitiot, Curator at @madparis, all invited by Creative Director @BrunoSialelli to discuss Lanvin’s past and present from their home. 
Full episode via @Lanvinofficial IGTV.

node.text:
Second episode: JEANNE LANVIN “Jeanne Lanvin’s beginnings as a milliner and her extraordinary entrepreneurial spirit have run through the house from its foundation in 1889. As the longest surviving fashion house in Paris, the archive reveals not only the transition from Lanvin’s modest beginnings as a milliner, and the evolution of fashionable feminine silhouettes, but how Lanvin presciently branched into sportswear, children’s wear, and perfume.”
Judith Clark

We look at #JeanneLanvin through conversations between professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_), and Creative Director @BrunoSialelli, the virtuoso milliner @stephenjonesmillinery and curator at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, #oriolecullen, to discuss Lanvin’s past and present from their home.

Full episode via @Lanvinofficial IGTV.
#Lanvin

node.text:
First episode: LANVIN BLUE “Looking at the Lanvin archive, the now iconic blue that comes from Early Renaissance paintings, and for which Jeanne Lanvin created a specific dye, returns in different forms. The silhouettes are bathed in blue, it is the blue that Berard choses as a scenic backdrop to her collections, it is the blue of longing and distance, so pertinent today, and it is the blue of 1930s Paris that finds its way to become the blue of Sialelli’s new androgyny.” Judith Clark

The theme of the quattrocento blue, here curated by professor & exhibition-maker #JudithClark (@prefigured_), featuring @Laure_Harivel, Head of Archives at Lanvin, @richard_haines, fashion illustrator & artist, and @shaptonia, writer & artist, all invited by Creative Director @BrunoSialelli to discuss Lanvin’s past and present from their home.

Full episode via @Lanvinofficial IGTV. 
#Lanvin
